message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the celestial bodies in our solar system. Our only satellite refers to the moon, and it is found with the other nine planets in our solar system. Option (B) refers to a cloud of gas and dust in space, option (C) refers to large stars in an advanced stage of evolution, and option (D) refers to a neighboring galaxy, none of which are related to the moon being our only satellite.

This question tests knowledge about the solar system and the Earth's moon. The Earth's only natural satellite, the moon, is found with the other nine planets in our solar system. Option (B) is incorrect because a nebula is a cloud of gas and dust in space, not a planet or satellite. Option (C) is incorrect because red giant stars are a type of star, not part of our solar system. Option (D) is incorrect because the Andromeda galaxy is a separate galaxy from our own and does not contain our moon.
